paragraphs.text: Thanks Karla

I am currently in the job hunting process and believe that one of my skills or traits is emotional intelligence and self-awareness. However, on one or two of these questions, I was stumped a little. This serves as a learning curve and a chance to improve going into job interviews!
paragraphs.name: 0cb4

content.subtitle: I am currently in the job hunting process and believe that one of my skills or traits is emotional intelligence and self-awareness. However…

paragraphs.text: This is so important! Emotional intelligence needs to be taken into account more often in the hiring process. Collaborative hiring can help get to the bottom of a candidate’s personality! Read more:

Honesty is an important factor in the interview process and it’s often hard to gauge. Connecting weaknesses with emotional intelligence is a unique point of view.

62b55bef358f.title: It’s also important to remember that an interview is an emotionally threatening situation.

paragraphs.text: It’s also important to remember that an interview is an emotionally threatening situation. Working with ways to make the interview itself safe will improve the quality of answers to questions like these. Being conversational instead of confrontational, for example…

Thanks Karla for the sharing! I have previously outlined an ideal colleague or employee to be someone who “exercises care, respect and kindness in speech and thought”. I realized it is more elegant to relabel the attribute as “emotional intelligence” and the “tell me more about” questions that you have provided are very actionable! Thank you! (:
paragraphs.name: 790a

aa5f263e1185.title: I’ve been a fan of using emotional intelligence in hiring for a long time, but this article from…

paragraphs.text: I’ve been a fan of using emotional intelligence in hiring for a long time, but this article from Adam Grant — one of the foremost experts in organizational psychology — has driven me to rethink it: https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/20140930125543-69244073-emotional-intelligence-is-overrated
paragraphs.name: bf79

91e3bd2bc5ca.title: The result of the “ME” driven society is many if not most have been programmed (parents, commercial…

paragraphs.text: The result of the “ME” driven society is many if not most have been programmed (parents, commercial advertising, media) to believe THEY are always right, therefore it must always be someone else’s fault. Participation trophies & safe spaces. Great article.

virtuals.subtitle: Among employees who fail to meet expectations during their first 18 months on the job, 23% fail due to low emotional intelligence. That’s…

content.subtitle: Among employees who fail to meet expectations during their first 18 months on the job, 23% fail due to low emotional intelligence. That’s…

paragraphs.text: Great article Karla Cook. The emotional intelligence or Emotional IQ of a future employee is such an important aspect to consider during the interview process. With today’s high standards in formal education every second person appears to look good on paper but how they are in the workplace shows how they can really contribute to a team. This is an excellent guide!

f6238863dc9f.title: Thanks so much for this Karla.

paragraphs.text: Thanks so much for this Karla.
paragraphs.name: e0e1

paragraphs.text: I’ve always struggled to understand these aspects of the candidate before hiring, and that has led to some mistakes. Your outline presents a clear and actionable process that I will certainly be incorporating into my into my interviews going forward!
